div.div: " We are wanting to do a family picture porch day for our yearbook. I would like to set a couple days where we could come by most homes and take a family picture of each family on their porches!
We are looking at Wednesday, April 29th, and Thursday, April 30th!!!
We would start around 10:00 am Hanston
If this is something you'd like to take part in please email your address to:
We will put you on the list.
We we come to your house we will honk take your picture and then we'll post some later!

Read more about Honor Roll Announced

span.span: Pawnee Heights will begin a district wide food program beginning on Tuesday, April 14th.
We will have lunches and the next days breakfast available in a "grab and go" format on all days that school is scheduled to be in session.
Pickup times will be as follows:
Rozel at the school's west door from 11:30-12:15
Hanston at the Elk Plaza from 11:45-12:30
You will need to pre-order meals for the week by noon the Friday prior to the week you are requesting food service.
Please email Tricia Colglazier at triciacolglazier@phtigers.net
Also please include in your email to Mrs. Colglazier where you would like you lunches delivered.
As always please stay home and stay safe.
For clarification lunches provided by the district will be free of charge for children birth through 18.

a.aria-label: Read more about USD 496 Food Pick-Up

div.p: Staff from Pawnee Heights schools worked last week to develop plans to continue providing in educational opportunities to all of our students. The district is also providing devices for students that don’t have ones at home. We are also working with GBT to provide internet services to families that don’t have access. Over the past few days everybody should have been contacted by school staff on specific details on how each grades continuous learning plan will look. If you have not been in contact with your students teacher please contact them by email via the school website. The current plan will have homework packet pickup on Thursdays in Rozel, Burdett, and Hanson, this is subject to change but is currently the plan. As more information becomes available, we will update everyone. Also, frequently check your email along with the districts Facebook page and website. Stay safe!!

p.span: PLEASE COMPLETE THE NEEDS SURVEY TO HELP SCHOOL STAFF
AS THEY DEVELOP OUR LEARNING CONTINUOUS LEARNING PLAN.

div.a: This institution is an equal opportunity provider.

p.span: The Pawnee Heights Board of Education mission is to guarantee all students a secure place and opportunity to acquire the scholastic, technical, social, and lifelong learning skills essential for success as productive citizens.

span.span:
Civil Rights Statement
Elementary and secondary school students, employees, applicants for admission and employment, and sources of referral of applicants for admission and employment are hereby notified that Unified School District 496 does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, handicap/disability, age, or religion in admission or access to, or treatment or employment in its programs and activities. Any person having inquiries concerning USD 496 compliance with the regulation implementing Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1064 (Title VI), Title IX of the Education amendments of 1972 (Title IX), Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 (Section 504) or Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 10990 (ADA) is directed to contact the ADA and Section 504 Coordinator, Mr. Casey Robinson 100 W.Grand PO Box 98 Rozel, KS 67574. 620-527-4514.
